PM.recommendation: Avoid codeine and tramadol. These prodrugs require CYP2D6 to convert to active metabolites. Poor metabolizers experience therapeutic failure. Use morphine (non-prodrug) or NSAIDs.

IM.recommendation: Reduced CYP2D6 activity leads to decreased conversion to active metabolites. Consider lower doses or alternative analgesics. Monitor for inadequate pain relief.

NM.recommendation: Standard dosing expected to produce normal analgesic effect. No pharmacogenomic dose adjustment required.

RM.recommendation: Slightly increased metabolism. Standard dosing is generally appropriate. Monitor for reduced efficacy at standard doses.

URM.recommendation: Avoid codeine — risk of fatal respiratory depression due to ultra-rapid conversion to morphine. Avoid tramadol similarly. Use non-prodrug analgesics.

PM.recommendation: Avoid clopidogrel — significantly reduced platelet inhibition increases cardiovascular event risk. Use prasugrel or ticagrelor. Omeprazole: consider dose reduction or pantoprazole.

IM.recommendation: Clopidogrel has reduced effectiveness. Consider alternative antiplatelet therapy especially in high-risk patients. Omeprazole may have modestly increased levels.

NM.recommendation: Standard dosing for clopidogrel and omeprazole. Normal CYP2C19 metabolism. No pharmacogenomic adjustment needed.

RM.recommendation: Enhanced metabolism may slightly increase clopidogrel efficacy. Standard dosing appropriate.

URM.recommendation: Clopidogrel: enhanced platelet inhibition may increase bleeding risk. Omeprazole: reduced efficacy due to rapid metabolism. Consider PPI dose increase.

PM.recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose 50-80%. Poor CYP2C9 metabolism leads to elevated warfarin levels and high bleeding risk. Initiate at ≤2mg/day with frequent INR monitoring.

IM.recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose by 20-40%. Intermediate CYP2C9 metabolism results in slower S-warfarin clearance. More frequent INR monitoring recommended.

NM.recommendation: Standard warfarin dosing algorithm applies. Normal CYP2C9 metabolism. Follow standard INR monitoring protocol.

RM.recommendation: May require slightly higher warfarin doses. Monitor INR and adjust accordingly.

URM.recommendation: May require higher warfarin doses for therapeutic INR. Rapid S-warfarin clearance can lead to subtherapeutic anticoagulation. Monitor INR frequently.

PM.recommendation: Avoid simvastatin or use ≤20mg/day. SLCO1B1 poor function leads to increased statin exposure and high myopathy/rhabdomyolysis risk. Use pravastatin or rosuvastatin.

IM.recommendation: Avoid simvastatin >20mg/day. Reduced hepatic uptake increases myopathy risk. Consider pravastatin or rosuvastatin. Monitor for muscle symptoms.

NM.recommendation: Standard simvastatin dosing. Normal hepatic uptake transporter function. Standard monitoring applies.

RM.recommendation: Normal to enhanced hepatic uptake. Standard dosing expected to be effective.

URM.recommendation: Enhanced hepatic uptake. Standard dosing is effective. No adjustment needed.

PM.recommendation: Reduce to 10% of standard dose or use alternative. TPMT-deficient patients accumulate cytotoxic thioguanine nucleotides causing fatal myelosuppression. Mandatory CBC monitoring.

IM.recommendation: Reduce starting dose 30-70%. Intermediate TPMT activity leads to higher thioguanine nucleotide levels. Monitor CBC weekly during initiation.

NM.recommendation: Standard dosing for azathioprine/6-MP. Normal TPMT activity. Monitor CBC per standard protocol.

RM.recommendation: May require increased doses for therapeutic effect. Rapid metabolism may reduce efficacy. Consider therapeutic drug monitoring.

URM.recommendation: May require significantly increased doses. Rapid TPMT metabolism shunts thiopurines away from cytotoxic pathway, reducing efficacy.

PM.recommendation: CONTRAINDICATED. Avoid fluoropyrimidines entirely. DPD-deficient patients cannot catabolize 5-FU, leading to fatal toxicity. Use alternative chemotherapy.

IM.recommendation: Reduce initial dose 25-50%. Partial DPD deficiency results in reduced 5-FU clearance. Monitor closely for early toxicity signs.

NM.recommendation: Standard fluoropyrimidine dosing per BSA-based calculation. Normal DPD activity. Monitor per standard oncology protocol.

RM.recommendation: May have reduced efficacy due to rapid 5-FU catabolism. Consider therapeutic drug monitoring.

URM.recommendation: Reduced efficacy likely due to rapid 5-FU catabolism. Evaluate dose increase or alternative regimens.
